summary: Runtime mode should support mouse and touch input for button presses, and log each press with the button's binary code and name.

existing_features.title: Update runtime-mode button interactions so a button press can be triggered reliably via either mouse or touch input (e.g., using Pointer Events) and does not require edit mode to be off.

When a runtime-mode button is pushed, log an event that includes (at minimum) the button's binary code and the button's name (use the control's label as the name). Ensure this information is persisted in the backend event log and returned by recent-events queries.
Update the Recent Signals UI to display the button name (label) alongside the binary code for logged button press events, so users can see both in the log.

new_feature_requests.summary: In runtime mode, allow buttons to be pressed via mouse or touch input and log the button's binary code and name on press.

projectName: Enable mouse/touch button presses in runtime mode and log button binary code + name
